ml:description.p: MarkLogic User Participation Sessions (Mark-UPS) will be meeting on Wednesday July 7th at 131 National Business Parkway, Suite 200. Get to know others in the area and follow-up on the great MarkLogic user community experience. Pizza and soda will be provided. Mark-UPS, is led by Telly Stroumbis (telly.stroumbis@boeing.com) of Boeing.
ml:description.div: Clark Richey, Jr. will present a preview of MarkLogic's upcoming 4.2 release. This release is packed with numerous major new features including several features designed specifically for the Federal community. Please join us for this unique opportunity to learn more about this exciting upcoming release!

Clark Richey, Jr. is the Principal Technologist, Federal at MarkLogic where he works closely with customers to help them architect maintainable, scalable solutions to their business problems. He is active in the developer community, providing technology education and best practices for using MarkLogic efficiently while gathering developer feedback for future product enhancements. Clark has spent more than ten years architecting and developing large scale systems for various government clients including the FBI, Department of Defense, Department of Labor, the Veterans Administration and various IC organizations. He is also a Java Champion and an associate professor at Loyola University. Clark has a B.S. in Computer Science from U.M.U.C. and a Master's Degree in Computer Science from American University.
Please RSVP so that we can pre-print badges and know how much food to order.
Note: advanced notice is required for non-U.S. Citizens.

ml:details.ml:location: 131 National Business Parkway, Suite 100, Annapolis Junction, MD 20701 (visitors need to sign in at Suite 120, see link below for map)
